info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 03 at 11:56PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...A line of heavy showers and scattered thunderstorms will affect portions of Los Angeles County through 100 AM PST Friday... At 1146 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated a line of heavy showers and scattered thunderstorms extending from the Santa Clarita Valley to southern Los Angeles County. This line was moving very slowly eastward while the storm cells within the line were moving northward. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Long Beach... Inglewood... Hollywood... Santa Clarita... Burbank... Beverly Hills... North Hollywood... Pasadena... and Downtown Los Angeles. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
